predicate.note: Frames file for 'return' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'come' 'give'

roleset.name: come back

example.name: typical
example.text: I need *trace* to return on Tuesday.

example.name: metaphorical
example.text: Parents are returning to the cloth diaper.

roleset.note: This is probably a different sense (Wordnet has 16 verbal senses for return) but the syntax seems to work.

roleset.name: give back

example.name: Japanese baseball
example.text: Fans politely return foul balls to stadium ushers.

example.name: seeking comment
example.text: Charles LaBella didn't return phone calls seeking comment.

roleset.note: Nothing is actually changing hands here, so it's a different sense, but the syntax is the same.

example.name: transitive active
example.text: The company had returned the plant to routine inspection in August.

roleset.name: send back

example.name: all args
example.text: Mr. Koskotas is fighting extradition proceedings that [*T*-2] would return him to Greece, where he is charged with embezzling more than $250 million from the Bank of Crete.
example.arg: Greece, where he is charged with embezzling more than $250 million from the Bank of Crete

roleset.note: Almost 'cause to come back' and thus closely related to return.01, but note that you can't have a source argument (at least not to my ears).
